entry.def: A footnote is a note at the bottom of a page in a book which provides more detailed information about something that is mentioned on that page.
If you refer to what you are saying as a footnote, you mean that you are adding some information that is related to what has just been mentioned.

example.ex: As a footnote, I should add that there was one point on which his bravado was more than justified.
example.tran: 我补充一句，他有时表现得过分逞强。

entry.tran: 无关紧要的事;次要事件
entry.def: If you describe an event as a footnote, you mean that it is fairly unimportant although it will probably be remembered.

example.ex: I'm afraid that his name will now become a footnote in history.
example.tran: 恐怕他的名字现在会成为历史的注脚。

means.word_mean: 1. a printed note placed below the text on a printed page
